p:
Temperature values determine also growth rate (with species-specific minima and maxima) and cohort survival rate (mancas proved to be the most sensitive). In one study, the lower lethal temperature (50% mortality) for
Porcellio scaber
Latreille was below zero, between -1.4 and -4.6 °C, with a super-cooling point at about -7 °C ( Tanaka and Udawaga 1993).
